definition: topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: The answers to difficult problems are usually not found in the same place as the problems.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能在问题的出处找到解决疑难问题的方法。

sentences.english: In practice, many knotty problems arise in the trial of bribery and corruption cases.
sentences.chinese: 实践中，贪污贿赂案件经常产生一些疑难问题。

sentences.english: The second part is the commercial bribe crime certain hard problem analysis.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是商业贿赂犯罪若干疑难问题研析。

sentences.english: She liked solving difficult scientific problems.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢解决科学上的疑难问题。

sentences.english: Chapter three is about the difficulties in sentencing criterion and the settlement.
sentences.chinese: 文章的第三章谈绑架罪定罪量刑疑难问题及解决。

sentences.english: Owing to the long history, there are some puzzling problems in historical literature recordation.
sentences.chinese: 但由于历史久远，历史文献记载尚有不少疑难问题。

sentences.english: The fourth part expounds problems related with law-breaking by cheating with credit cards.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分主要论述了有关信用卡诈骗罪的疑难问题。

definition: hard to understand/difficult to deal with/knotty/complicated
to answer questions (as teacher or consultant)/to clarify doubts
practice (customary action, as opposed to theory)/practical
to dispel doubts/to clear up difficulties
to settle (a dispute)/to resolve/to solve/to dispose of/to dispatch
to give guidance/to mentor/to counsel/to coach/to tutor
